description: We need also install a flatpak to app recognize the sdk java, the command is: "flatpak install flathub org.freedesktop.Sdk.Extension.openjdk21". I did the sdk installation, but when I tried to compile and execute a java.net source code, it didn't work, a compilation error occurred. I tried to compile and execute the same source code on original intellij downloaded from jetbrains website and it worked succesfully. Unfortunately, this app is a problem to work with. Many small problems that appear on the way to make life difficult
summary: It don't recognize the java sdk automatically

description: To create a project, the first thing you have to do is define where your Java installation is. On Linux, this is /usr/lib/jvm/something. But the file selection dialog can't even see the /usr/lib/jvm directory, so you can't select it and you therefore can't create a project. So, it's completely worthless. The packages need to actually run a basic test before they release the software.
Unusable, cannot select the an SDK. I feel like installing Intellij from Jetbrains' toolbox is the best option. I don't know why the maintainers bother pushing broken packages in the FlatHub repos.
cannot select sdk
For those having issues selecting the SDK, you need the official JDK from Oracle.
It appears that the JDK selection problem was fixed. Nice to have it as a flatpak.
I used for over a week and I am pretty happy about it, everything works great.

Install the package "org.freedesktop.Sdk.Extension.openjdk11" from flathub, and then the SDK will be available inside IDEA's sandboxed file system. The JDK will be available at /lib/sdk/openjdk11/jvm/openjdk-11
summary: You have to install the Flatpak package of the JDK, then it works

description: IntelliJ IDEA is a great and feature-rich IDE, especially for anything Java/Kotlin. Nice to have it as a flatpak now!
The /usr/lib/jvm directory can be found under /var/run/host/usr/lib/jvm
summary: Minor flatpak sandbox issue, easy to solve

description: It seems like the profiling feature is only availible on the ultimate edition
If you install the Flatpak then JDK is at /var/run/host/usr/lib/jvm

The official tarball from Jetbrains works
Why so big in size?

Since this runs in a sandbox thanks to Flatpak, a lot of the elements in your actual environment (such as executables, files, terminal path etc) will not work. This is a fundamentally broken version of IntelliJ because of Flatpak and should never be used.
summary: DO NOT USE- Flatpak breaks this

description: Have been using it for more than a month and works great. Nothing to complain really.
summary: Works! Fast, smooth, minimal memory usage, etc

description: Loved it! Running under both my laptop and Desktop and no crashes or higher memory usage at all.
summary: It works and is very functional!

description: Flatpak isolation makes it useless, can't use any programs installed on the host

Depending on which cloud integration plugins you use that don't have the option to shut off telemetry, like Tabnine, CodeStream, or some others, you can be continuously streaming your interaction and project data in the background without your knowledge. I recommended to install Flatseal and shut off Network until you really need it. No program I've used has needed IPC except OBS Studio.

GNU needs a quality outbound interactive firewall with heuristics for power users, Internet Security software has had this for decades on windoze.
summary: Program can open a lot of background connections

description: it work best for me
cannot select jdk

I have an issue, /dev/kvm is not found!

I try this, but permission override not solved my issue.
sudo flatpak override com.jetbrains.IntelliJ-IDEA-Community --filesystem=/dev/kvm
Love intellij, just hate the flatpak setup
summary: flatpak has no user environment, insanely difficult to do basic things

description: Since this version of IntelliJ is sandboxed by FlatPak, one needs to have the JDKs installed in a location it can access. The ones installed by the system's package manager are usually not accessible but one can use a tool like sdkman or asdf to install a JDK into the user's home directory. I prefer doing it this way anyway because it gives me access to newer JDK versions that those that are shipped by my OS, and it also lets me easily have multiple versions side-by-side.
summary: Works great if you setup things properly

description: Cool

Why did they change the icon???

It was beautiful, now it sucks.

With the markdown plugins it is simply the best markdown editor around.
Text formatting, creating tables, pasting pictures, and then checking the preview.
And apparently it can also do things like java.
Love it as is, and work on mistakes since 2019 all bugs are fixed

It's a great (and probably the most polished) Java IDE out there, especially for beginners. Had no issues with setting up the JDK on the Flatpak version. The only problem is performance: it still runs smoothly, without issues, but you can still feel that's slower than Eclipse or NetBeans.

I get the 'Cannot detect SDK version' issue whenever I try to use an existing Python virtualenv, probably due to sandboxing. Couldn't find out how to resolve this issue. No problems with the non-flatpak version.

rather than finding the folder for jdk or overwrite it with some commands, there is option while creating a new project you can download the openJDK to specific folder ( no need to place in root ) and it will work fine.
summary: for sandboxing , below tip might help

Compared to other IDE flatpaks works great.

IDE do not find where java installation is. I try to fix, search forums and etc, did not like any solution (change security, change java installation folder). So, I give up. Installed VSCode and it works easy, without any problems.
When trying to upgrade to latest intellij flatpak version, getting exceeded maximum size of 2693773 bytes. Will revise when update issues are resolved.
Let's me do everything that has been complained about in the reviews.

Durch die Sandbox funktioniert die Docker-Integration leider nicht. Auch das eingebaute Terminal ist nur sehr begrenzt bis gar nicht nutzbar, da es innerhalb des Flatpaks operiert, und entsprechend nur von Idea im Flatpak installierte Tools wie git aufrufbar sind (so was wie apt aber zum Beispiel nicht).

Dann doch lieber eine unsichere Installation ohne Sandbox (wie sie z. B. beim Snap-Paket vollzogen wird) – die hat solche Probleme nicht.
summary: Großartige IDE, aber das Flatpak hat teilweise Probleme
